question: What is the purpose of the alt attribute in an tag?
options: To provide a text description of the image if it cannot be displayed.
To alternate the image source if the original source fails.
To specify alternative styles for the image.
To provide an alternate URL for the image.
correctAnswer: To provide a text description of the image if it cannot be displayed.
explanation: The alt attribute provides a text alternative for the image if it cannot be displayed, which is useful for accessibility.

question: What does the for attribute in a <label> element specify?
options: The form data that should be sent when submitting the form.
The ID of the form element the label is bound to.
The name of the form the label belongs to.
The encoding type of the form data.
correctAnswer: The ID of the form element the label is bound to.
explanation: The for attribute associates the label with an input element by matching the input's ID.

question: How do you ensure that a group of radio buttons allows only one selection at a time?
options: Give each input a unique name attribute.
Give each input the same value attribute.
Give each input the same type attribute.
Give each input the same name attribute.
correctAnswer: Give each input the same name attribute.
explanation: Giving each radio button in a group the same name attribute ensures that only one can be selected at any time.

question: In CSS, which selector has the highest specificity?
explanation: Inline styles have the highest specificity compared to selectors in external or internal stylesheets.

question: What is the default behavior of a form when the submit button is clicked?
options: The form data is saved locally.
The form is cleared of all data.
The form data is sent to the server.
The form checks for empty required fields.
correctAnswer: The form data is sent to the server.
explanation: By default, when a submit button in a form is clicked, the form data is sent to the server specified in the formâ€™s action attribute.

question: Which HTML attribute is used to define the maximum number of characters allowed in an <input> field?
explanation: The maxlength attribute specifies the maximum number of characters allowed in an input field.

question: Which HTML tag is used to create a drop-down list?
explanation: The <select> tag is used to create a drop-down list.

question: How can you make a text input field read-only?
explanation: The readonly attribute makes the <input> field unmodifiable, although the user can still focus and copy text from it.

question: What does the target="_blank" attribute in an anchor tag do?
options: Opens the linked document in a new window or tab.
Opens the linked document in the same frame.
Specifies that the linked document should be shown in full-screen.
correctAnswer: Opens the linked document in a new window or tab.
explanation: The target="_blank" attribute in an anchor tag specifies that the link should open in a new window or tab.

question: What attribute is used with to handle image maps?
explanation: The 'usemap' attribute in the tag associates the image with an image map defined by a element.

question: Which HTML5 element is used to specify a footer for a document or section?
explanation: The <footer> element is used to define a footer for a document or a section.

question: What does CSS stand for?
explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets, a language used to describe the presentation of a document written in HTML.

question: In CSS, what property is used to change the text color of an element?
explanation: The 'color' property is used in CSS to define the color of the text inside an element.

question: Which HTML tag is used to define emphasized text?
explanation: The <em> tag is used to indicate emphasis that subtly changes the meaning of a sentence.

question: What property is used to set the spacing between lines of text in CSS?
explanation: The 'line-height' property is used in CSS to set the amount of space used for lines, such as in text.

question: Which element is used in HTML to create a line break?
explanation:
The
tag is used in HTML to insert a line break between lines of text.

question: Which attribute in HTML5 specifies that an input field must be filled out before submitting the form?
explanation: The 'required' attribute of an input tag specifies that the field must be filled out before the form can be submitted.

question: What HTML element is used for the largest heading?
explanation: The <h1> element is used for the largest level of heading in HTML.

question: What HTML tag is used to define an internal style sheet?
explanation: The <style> tag is used to define style information (CSS) for a document. Inside this tag, you specify how HTML elements should render in the browser.

question: Which CSS property controls the text size?
explanation: The 'font-size' property is used in CSS to specify the size of the text. Values can be specified in units such as px, em, rem, etc.

question: Which HTML attribute specifies an alternate text for an image, if the image cannot be displayed?
explanation: The 'alt' attribute provides alternative information for an image if a user for some reason cannot view it (because of slow connection, an error in the src attribute, or if the user uses a screen reader).

question: How do you make each word in a text start with a capital letter?
explanation: The CSS 'text-transform' property is used to specify uppercase and lowercase letters in a text. The 'capitalize' value transforms the first character of each word to uppercase.

question: What does HTML stand for?
explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language. It is the standard markup language for creating Web pages and describes the structure of a Web page.

question: Which doctype is correct for HTML5?
explanation: The <!DOCTYPE html> declaration defines this document to be HTML5, and is placed at the very beginning of an HTML document.

question: What does the 'DOCTYPE' declaration specify?
options: The version of HTML to use
The link between a document and an external resource
The programming language the document is written in
The character encoding of the document
correctAnswer: The version of HTML to use
explanation: The DOCTYPE declaration is not an HTML tag; it is an instruction to the web browser about what version of HTML the page is written in.

question: Which HTML element is used to specify a header for a document or section?
explanation: The <header> element represents a container for introductory content or a set of navigational links.

question: Which property is used to change the font of an element in CSS?
explanation: The font-family property specifies the font of an element.

question: What is the purpose of the alt attribute for images in HTML?
options: To provide a description of the image
To make the image load faster
To present alternative content if the image cannot be displayed
Both A and C are correct
correctAnswer: Both A and C are correct
explanation: The alt attribute provides alternative information for an image if a user cannot view it for any reason.

question: Which HTML tag is used to display a picture?
explanation: The tag is used to embed images in an HTML page.

question: What property is used to specify the space between elements in CSS?
explanation: The margin property controls the space between the borders of adjacent elements.

question: Which tag is used to define an interactive field where users can enter data?
explanation: The <input> tag specifies an input field where users can enter data.

question: In CSS, how do you select an element with the id 'demo'?
explanation: In CSS, to select an element with a specific id, you use the # symbol followed by the id of the element.

question: What is the default display value for most elements?
explanation: Most HTML elements are block-level elements by default, which means they start on a new line and take up the full width available.

question: How do you make a list that lists its items with squares?
explanation: The list-style-type property applies styles to list items, and 'square' is a valid value that styles the list item markers with squares.

question: Which element is used to define important text in HTML?
explanation: The <strong> element is used to define text with strong importance, and the content inside is typically displayed in bold.

question: What does CSS stand for?
explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets; it describes how HTML elements are to be displayed on screen, paper, or in other media.

question: Which attribute specifies a link's destination?
explanation: The href attribute specifies the URL of the page the link goes to.

question: Which CSS property controls the text size?
explanation: The font-size property is used in CSS to change the size of the text displayed.

question: What HTML tag is used to define a table heading?
explanation: The <th> tag is used to define a header cell in an HTML table.

question: What HTML attribute prevents a link from being followed or indexed?
explanation: The rel="nofollow" attribute in an anchor tag instructs search engines not to follow the link or pass on any authority through that link.

question: Which HTML5 input type defines a slider control?
explanation: <input type="range"> defines a control for entering a number whose exact value is not important.

question: What CSS property is used to make the background color of an element semi-transparent?
explanation: Using rgba for the background color allows you to specify an alpha value, which defines the opacity.

question: How do you apply a CSS style for all buttons of class 'btn' when they are hovered over?
explanation: button.btn:hover { } correctly selects buttons with class 'btn' and applies styles when they are hovered over.

question: Which HTML tag is specifically used for embedding a video file?
explanation: The <video> tag is used to embed video content in a document.

question: Which attribute in <video> is used to automatically start playing as soon as it can do so without stopping to finish loading?
explanation: The autoplay attribute is a boolean attribute; when specified, the video will automatically begin to play back as soon as it can do so without stopping.

question: What is the purpose of HTML5's <aside> element?
options: To mark additional information that can enhance another element but is not required.
To contain the main content of the webpage.
To define something that should be emphasized.
correctAnswer: To mark additional information that can enhance another element but is not required.
explanation: The <aside> element is used for content that is tangentially related to the content around it.

question: What CSS property is used to specify the stacking order of an element?
explanation: z-index is used to specify the stack order of an element (which element should be placed in front of, or behind, the others).

question: Which attribute is necessary to specify the image path in an tag?
explanation: The src (source) attribute is required for the tag to function, as it specifies the path to the image to be displayed.

question: What does the <datalist> element in HTML5 do?
options: Creates a new data storage for client-side content.
Specifies a list of pre-defined options for input controls.
Lists data in a table-like format.
Connects to a database to fetch data based on user input.
correctAnswer: Specifies a list of pre-defined options for input controls.
explanation: The <datalist> element contains a set of <option> elements that represent the permissible or suggested options available to users in other controls.

question: In CSS, what is the difference between visibility: hidden; and display: none;?
options: visibility: hidden; removes the element from the DOM, while display: none; does not.
visibility: hidden; hides the element but it still takes up space, while display: none; removes it from the document flow.
display: none; changes the opacity to zero, visibility: hidden; does not.
correctAnswer: visibility: hidden; hides the element but it still takes up space, while display: none; removes it from the document flow.
explanation: visibility: hidden; keeps the element in the document layout but makes it invisible, while display: none; removes the element completely from the document layout.

question: What is the use of the 'display' property in CSS?
options: It specifies how long an animation should take.
It changes the type of cursor.
It controls the layout of an element.
It sets the visibility of an element.
correctAnswer: It controls the layout of an element.
explanation: The 'display' property is used in CSS to control the display type of an element, influencing both the layout and the type of box it generates.

elements inside

elements in CSS?
explanation:
The selector 'div p {}' selects all

elements that are descendants of

elements, not just direct children.

question: What is the purpose of the 'alt' attribute for images in HTML?
options: To provide a description of the image
To make the image load faster
To present alternative content if the image cannot be displayed
Both A and C are correct
correctAnswer: Both A and C are correct
explanation: The 'alt' attribute provides alternative information for an image if a user cannot view it for any reason.

question: How can CSS be embedded into an HTML document?
options: Using the <link> element in the document head.
Using the <style> element in the document head.
Inline, by using the 'style' attribute on elements.
explanation: CSS can be added to HTML by linking to an external stylesheet, embedding with the <style> element, or using inline styles.

question: What is the difference between classes and IDs in CSS?
options: IDs are unique per page and classes are not.
Classes are unique per page and IDs are not.
IDs are used for JavaScript and classes for CSS.
There is no difference between them.
correctAnswer: IDs are unique per page and classes are not.
explanation: In CSS, an ID uniquely identifies one element on a page, while a class can be used to style multiple elements.

question: Which HTML5 element is best suited for a container of navigation links?
explanation: The <nav> element is specifically meant to contain navigation links, according to HTML5 semantics.

question: What does 'flex' do in the display property of a container?
options: Allows you to manage space distribution and alignment of children elements flexibly.
Provides high flexibility to JavaScript functions.
correctAnswer: Allows you to manage space distribution and alignment of children elements flexibly.
explanation: The 'display: flex' property enables a flexible container layout that can dynamically adjust its children elements.

question: How do you apply a CSS rule to only an element with both a specific class and id?
explanation: To select an element with both an id and a class, the selector should combine them without spaces, like '#id.class'.

question: What HTML attribute specifies an alternate text for an image, if the image cannot be displayed?
explanation: The 'alt' attribute provides alternative information for an image if a user for some reason cannot view it (because of slow connection, an error in the src attribute, or if the user uses a screen reader).

question: In CSS, how do you select elements where the type is 'button'?
explanation: All of these selectors will correctly select elements where the type attribute is set to 'button'.

question: What is a semantic element in HTML?
options: An element that has no meaning
An element that clearly describes its meaning to both the browser and the developer
An element that enhances the aesthetics of the webpage
An element used only for layout purposes
correctAnswer: An element that clearly describes its meaning to both the browser and the developer
explanation: Semantic elements clearly define their content which helps the browser and developers understand the meaning of the content.

question: What does the 'box-sizing' property do in CSS?
options: Controls the animation timing of a box.
Alters the fundamental box model layout.
Defines how the width and height of a box are calculated.
correctAnswer: Defines how the width and height of a box are calculated.
explanation: 'box-sizing' property in CSS can change how the width and height of an element are calculated, whether they include padding and borders or not.

question: Which HTML attribute is used to set the width of an element?
explanation: The 'width' attribute specifically sets the width of an image element in HTML.

question: What is the purpose of the <meta> tag in HTML?
options: To store metadata such as the page description, keywords, author of the document.
Both A and B are correct.
correctAnswer: Both A and B are correct.
explanation: The <meta> tag is used to specify metadata like page description, keywords, author, and also for setting up character set and viewport settings, as well as for auto-refreshing the page.

question: What is the function of the CSS 'overflow' property?
options: It specifies what should happen if content overflows an element's box.
It creates additional space around an element's content.
It adds scroll bars to an element automatically.
It hides any content that overflows.
correctAnswer: It specifies what should happen if content overflows an element's box.
explanation: The 'overflow' property specifies whether to clip content, add scrollbars or display overflow content of a block-level element.

question: How can you make a list that displays its items with roman numerals?
explanation: The 'list-style-type: upper-roman;' property in CSS changes the list item markers to upper-case Roman numerals.

question: Which HTML tag is used to define a section of a document intended for navigation?
explanation: The <nav> element is meant to house the navigation links in your document.

question: In CSS, what property is used to create space between the border and the content of an element?
explanation: Padding is used to create space between the border and the content of an element.

question: What does the 'href' attribute in the <link> tag specify?
options: The relationship between the current document and the linked document.
The location of the linked document or resource.
The type of media the linked document is designed for.
The size of the linked resource.
correctAnswer: The location of the linked document or resource.
explanation: In the <link> tag, the 'href' attribute specifies the URL of the linked document or resource.

question: Which CSS property changes the text color of an element?
explanation: The 'color' property in CSS is used to set the color of the text inside an element.

question: What is the purpose of the HTML <title> tag?
options: To create a large, bold title inside the body.
To define the title of the document, shown in the browser's title bar or tab.
To add a heading in the HTML document.
To specify the scripting language used in the document.
correctAnswer: To define the title of the document, shown in the browser's title bar or tab.
explanation: The <title> tag defines the title of the document, which is displayed in the browser's title bar or tab.

question: How do you apply a style for all <h1> tags inside <div>s with class 'header'?
explanation: The selector 'div.header h1 {}' correctly applies styles to all <h1> elements within <div> elements with class 'header'.

question: What does the 'srcset' attribute in an tag do?
options: Specifies a set of images for different display/device conditions.
Defines the source file for the image.
Sets multiple sources for backup if the original fails.
Controls the resizing of the image.
correctAnswer: Specifies a set of images for different display/device conditions.
explanation: The 'srcset' attribute allows you to specify a list of image files to display in different situations (e.g., varying resolutions or device conditions).

question: What is the difference between the CSS properties 'visibility: hidden' and 'display: none'?
options: visibility: hidden retains the element's space, display: none does not.
display: none retains the element's space, visibility: hidden does not.
visibility: hidden deletes the element from the document, display: none does not.
There is no practical difference between the two.
correctAnswer: visibility: hidden retains the element's space, display: none does not.
explanation: 'visibility: hidden' makes the element invisible while still occupying space in the layout, whereas 'display: none' removes the element from the flow, not occupying any space.

question: Which HTML element is used to specify independent, self-contained content?
explanation: An <article> element is meant to be used for independent, self-contained content.

question:
In CSS, how can you make every

element's first letter increase in size?
explanation: The ::first-letter pseudo-element is used to apply a style to the first letter of the first line of a block-level element, in this case making it larger.
